intro: Crepis boetica, commonly known as the Boetica mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of many small florets. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along roadsides. Its leaves are usually hairy and spoon-shaped, while the flowers are small and yellow, appearing in clusters. Crepis boetica is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
